Caption: Figure 20: A side-by-side comparison of cross validation results for stroke constraints. (a) Ground truth. (b) MFA. (c) PCA.
Mention:
LWR and PCA tend to be closest to our method in terms of the
cross validation 3D errors. We therefore present some visual re-
sults of these two techniques compared with our method. Figures
17, 18, 19, and 20 show the side-by-side comparisons for different
examples: MFA can produce better perceptual results than LWR
and PCA.
LWR and PCA also tend to be closest to our method in terms of
the 2D errors. We again refer to figures 17, 18, 19, and 20 to show
MFA can produce better visual results than LWR and PCA.
